messages: 995b15da895d895b607cb0175432d850 (11:18): stiv2k: wireless is basically limted to three walls
995b15da895d895b607cb0175432d850 (11:18): stiv2k: and less is better
995b15da895d895b607cb0175432d850 (11:18): so, no you can't see completely through a bunch of houses
995b15da895d895b607cb0175432d850 (11:18): unless they all have windows that line up, and are always open
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:18): hahaha
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:18): what if you had a crazy powerful antenna of some sort
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:19): sure it won't be legal
995b15da895d895b607cb0175432d850 (11:19): do you have site to site LOS from the roof ridge ?
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:19): then you could go farther
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:19): but a lot of shit i do is illegal
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:19): also, you can be legal with quite big antennas as long as its P2P
995b15da895d895b607cb0175432d850 (11:19): stiv2k: true you could, but walls and trees are good at limiting your options
995b15da895d895b607cb0175432d850 (11:19): DrDT: muh?  What crack are you smoking?
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:19): its against FCC
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:19): heh
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:20): eiggirC: the FCC crack,
995b15da895d895b607cb0175432d850 (11:20): DrDT: Depending on yor locality its "total power output must not exceed XXX"
995b15da895d895b607cb0175432d850 (11:20): DrDT: there's absolutely nothing about protocols
995b15da895d895b607cb0175432d850 (11:20): its transmission power
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:20): eiggirC: obviously not, read it.
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:20): lol
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:20): hm
995b15da895d895b607cb0175432d850 (11:20): 18:17 < DrDT> also, you can be legal with quite big antennas as long as its P2P
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:21): well my friend lives 2 houses down
995b15da895d895b607cb0175432d850 (11:21): or did you mean point to point?
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:21): thaqt's obviously what i mean
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:21): i wonder if a pair of simple cantennas pointed at eachother would work
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:21): what other p2p would apply to antenna output power?
995b15da895d895b607cb0175432d850 (11:21): DrDT: well its still total transmisison power, regardless if its across the room or across the road or suburb or whatever
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:21): 2 houses isn't that far...
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:21): eiggirC: obviously
995b15da895d895b607cb0175432d850 (11:21): DrDT: yeah actually read "p2p" and thought filesharing
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:21): and that tx power can be quite higher if it's p2p
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:21): instead of p2mp
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:22): well, lurk moar dammit
995b15da895d895b607cb0175432d850 (11:22): as long as its legal you're safe.

05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:22): it says you can go up to 48dbm if it's p2p and you reduce your amp output by whatever amount you add to the antenna... IIRC 1dbm less amp output for each 3dbm antenna gain
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:24): which means, again IIRC (I'm tired) that you're legal with a p2p setup with each end at 24dbm amp output and 24dbi antenna gain
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:24): which is a huge-ass amount of power for the wireless we do
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:24): you could easily punch through a few houses with that
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:25): stiv2k: you could try cantennas, but I'd say you might as well go to 19dbi (or 24dbi, but they're huge) dishes to get lots of signal
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:25): yeah
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:26): but i dont wanna spend hundreds of dollars for that
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:26): i made a cantenna
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:26): 19s aren't that much
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:26): i can pick up a bunch of networks
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:26): but none of them are strong enough to connect to it seems
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:26): you can't trust the gain on a home-made cantenna much
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:26): hehe
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:26): im just experimenting
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:26): esp. if you're not experienced at doing it
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:26): uh
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:26): "pick up" in kismet or netstumbler?
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:27): kismet
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:27): oops
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:27): netstumbler i mean
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:27): ok, if you said Kismet I'd say don't consider that a proof of your antenna
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:28): kismet is receive-only, so if your antenna had a high SWR (bad) you wouldn't notice it much.
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:28): no, i don't like kismet
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:28): i've used it though
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:28): but i used netstumbler in this case
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:28): but netstumbler broadcasts, so if you can pick up stuff it means you're at least transmitting not-bad.
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:29): DrDT: in windows wireless zero thing...the highest signal strength i got was 1 bar
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:29): and it wouldn't connect
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:29): stiv2k: that measure is useless.
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:29): i have heard somewhere that it doesnt matter how poweful your antenna is,
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:29): it's card-specific
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:29): if the AP isn't powerful enough to hear your packets, it wont work
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:29): or something along those lines
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:30): that would be wrong, antenna is very important, and you get tx gain as well as RX
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:30): someone in this channel said that
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:30): stiv2k: good, having a good chipset is important
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:30): yeah
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:30): i spent 70 bucks on it
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:30): i hope i can make it worth it

abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:31): alright, so theoretically, would it be possible to build/buy an antenna to connect to a friend's network without having to have them put an antenna on their side
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:31): stiv2k: possibly, but that's hard
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:31): DrDT: while it is atheros, its weak
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:31): it says like 65mw on the datasheet
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:31): DrDT: like i said they live only 2 houses down
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:32): i want to use as little equip. as possible
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:32): stiv2k: that's because you got a cheapy one, that's a usual power for cheapy atheros
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:32): $70 is cheapy?
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:32): heh
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:32): and if you're going through a few houses it'll be unlikely to happen without an antenna at their end
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:33): i wanna mess around with more homemad antennas before i move onto commercial ones
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:33): 2 houses you can probably do with only good quip. at your end, as long as their cards/antennas aren't complete crap.
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:33): i believe its a linksys WRT54g
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:33): a good PC card costs 130$US (ubiquiti atheros 300mw)
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:33): jesus
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:34): stiv2k: WRT54Gs have broadcom chipsets which aren't great
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:34): but you can try it
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:34): i didn't know the chipset mattered
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:34): you should expect it... rf design is hard
abc06c0a7619edcdce38996e38b1d01a (11:34): what's a good router?
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:35): apparently other than the radio the wrt54g series are good, except for the vxworks ones
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:36): I consider D-link the least crappy cheap router brand, although they've had a few crap ones, and Linksys is pretty close.
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:36): either way, I need sleep
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:37): we should have "which is a good router/radio/how do I do this short link" questions in the FAQ if we don't have already
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:37): since they're quite common
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (11:37): anyways, g'nite guys
